temporalimage package¶

temporalimage.t4d module¶

class temporalimage.t4d.TemporalImage(dataobj, affine, frameStart, frameEnd, time_unit=None, header=None, extra=None, file_map=None)[source]¶

Bases: nibabel.spatialimages.SpatialImage

dynamic_mean(weights=None)[source]¶

Compute the weighted dynamic mean of the 4D temporal image.

Parameters:weights ({ None, ‘frameduration’ }) – If weights==’frameduration’, each frame is weighted proportionally to its duration (inverse variance weighting).
extractTime(startTime, endTime)[source]¶

Extract a 4D temporal image from a longer-duration 4D temporal image

Parameters:
  • startTime (float) – time at which to begin, inclusive
  • endTime (float) – time at which to stop, exclusive
gaussian_filter(sigma, **kwargs)[source]¶

Perform gaussian filtering of each time point. Returns the 4D matrix with smoothed values.

Any argument that scipy.ndimage.gaussian_filter takes can also be specified.

Parameters:sigma (scalar or sequence of scalars) – Standard deviation for Gaussian kernel (in voxels). The standard deviations of the Gaussian filter are given for each axis as a sequence, or as a single number, in which case it is equal for all of the first three axes.

See also

scipy.ndimage.gaussian_filter()
Gaussian filtering of 3D image

roi_timeseries(maskfile=None, mask=None)[source]¶

Get the mean time activity curve (TAC) within a region of interest (ROI)

Parameters:
  • maskfile (string) – mask file name
  • mask (array_like) – 3D mask data matrix consisting of bool
splitTime(splitTime)[source]¶

Split the 4D temporal image into two 4D temporal images

Parameters:splitTime (float) – time at which to split the 4D image. First of the two split images will not include splitTime. Second of the two split images will include splitTime.
temporalimage.t4d.load(filename, timingfilename, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load a temporal image

Parameters:
  • filename (string) – specification of 4D image file to load
  • timingfilename (string) – specification of the csv file containing frame timing information
temporalimage.t4d.save(img, filename, timingfilename)[source]¶

Save a temporal image

Parameters:
  • img (TemporalImage) – temporal 4D image to save
  • filename (string) – specification of output image filename
  • timingfilename (string) – specification of output csv filename for timing information
